As an AI language model I do not have personal opinions or experience, but research shows that music therapists use a variety of techniques to help people with mental health issues. Some of these techniques are:

1. Active music making: This involves playing an instrument or singing. This can help people with mental health issues to express themselves, boost their confidence and self-esteem, and reduce anxiety.

2. Improvisation: This technique involves creating music spontaneously. Improvisation can help individuals with mental health issues to express themselves, relax, and improve their communication and social skills.

3. Music listening: Listening to music can help people with mental health issues to relax, reduce anxiety, and improve their mood.

4. Songwriting: Writing songs about their experiences can help individuals with mental health issues to express themselves, process their emotions and experiences, and develop a sense of empowerment.

5. Guided imagery: This technique uses music to help individuals with mental health issues to visualize calming, positive images. This can help reduce anxiety, depression, and other mental health symptoms.

Overall, music therapy can be a powerful tool for promoting mental and emotional wellbeing, reducing symptoms of mental health disorders, and helping individuals to improve their quality of life.
